page.title: 15RADCLIFFE TOWER
page.content: THE EXACT AGE OF RADCLIFFE TOWER CANNOT BE DETERMINED,BUT THE FIRST NOTICE OF IT WAS GIVEN IN THE YEAR{ {1358}WHEN RICHARD DE RADCLIFFE,WHO WAS THE HIGH SHERRIFF OF LANCASTER AT THE TIME DESCRIBED THE TOWER AS PROBABLY BUILT DURING THE{SAXON PERIOD ,A CRUDE BUILDING WITH ONE PRIMARY PURPOSE{STRENGTH}. THE GREAT RESIDENCE WAS SURROUNDED BY PARKLAND,THE RIVER IRWELL FLOWING NEAR. THE MANORIAL RESIDENCE WAS KEPT UP IN ITS ORIGINAL INTEGRITY DURING THE MANORIAL RULE OF THE RADCLIFFES. THE DECAY BEGAN, WHEN THE MANOR AND ITS ESTATES WERE SOLD TO{RICHARD {ASHTON.} IN THE SUMMER OF 1905 VISITORS TO THE TOWER SAID{"THE REMAINS STAND ON IN {EMINENCE"};NOW ALL THAT IS LEFT IF THE RUIN OF ONE TOWER.
